channel.title: I cant get onto router - Impossible to make server?
channel.description: I cant get onto my router, im unsure of the IP adress and I dont know the username and password. Finding it out is out of the question, becouse our company are bastards... Is there any other way I can make a server?

item.title: I cant get onto router - Impossible to make server?
item.dc:creator: @fafaerer fafaerer
item.description:
@fafaerer wrote:

you dont need a router OR a modem, for example… i had Dial-Up and ran a server, and i didn’t have a router or modem. When you have a router or modem, all it really means is that you might have to port-forward. An exaple of this is that whenever i go to my grandmas house, she has dsl internet, and hook up my laprop to her modem, i dont have to do anything. But when im at my dads house, who also has dsl and a modem(with a non-dynamic ip adress), i have to port-forward. On a router its the same, its just that a router is most of the time used for multiple connections on the same internet line(but can still be hooked up to pc and used as if dsl), it is wireless for the most, so be prepared to get your router or provider password. Also, for the modem, if you’re port-forwarding, you need your router or provider password. Hope i helped.

Read full topic
item.source: I cant get onto router - Impossible to make server?

item.title: I cant get onto router - Impossible to make server?
item.dc:creator: @Daelil Daelil
item.description:
@Daelil wrote:

by mod taharok:

Ok this is fairly simple how to set up a no-ip for your server. First off go to no-ip:

No-ip

Then make a new account/log-in. Then click on “Redirect/host” button. Then put in the name of your server and make the domain
anything you want/ anything that is available. Make sure that the IP address in there is your INTERNET IP ADRESS, NOT your
computer’s IP address. This will show at the top-right-hand-corner of the no-ip screen. This will show your INTERNET IP ADDRESS.
Ok now save it and now as the long as the rule in the router is set and the server is running; then you and other people should be
able to use that new domain you made to log into your server!

So how do I do chapter 6 then if i use a ham server???[br][size=1]Posted at: December 20, 2006, 09:07:51 AM[/size][hr]

Ok now save it and now as the long as the rule in the router
I cant do that bit can I so how do I do it.

Read full topic

item.title: I cant get onto router - Impossible to make server?
item.dc:creator: @Nub.exe Nub.exe
item.description:
@Nub.exe wrote:

Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into "advanced" (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the "gaming" button (is only left side for me...) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:

Name: 1
IP address: 2
TCP Ports to open: 43594
UDP Ports to open:
Inbound Filter: Allow All
Schedule: Always

KEY
1 = Any name you want the server to be (I.E.MyScape).[/glow]
2 = The IP adddress of your COMPUTER; not the Internet.
Then save it. Ok now you can save settings after the rule is saved. Every router is different. Check with the manuals for yours to fully understand how to open the ports. If you cannot find/have a manuel, go to this address:

That stuff only.

Read full topic
item.source: I cant get onto router - Impossible to make server?

item.title: I cant get onto router - Impossible to make server?
item.dc:creator: @Daelil Daelil
item.description:
@Daelil wrote:

Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into "advanced" (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the "gaming" button (is only left side for me...) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:

Name: 1
IP address: 2
TCP Ports to open: 43594
UDP Ports to open:
Inbound Filter: Allow All
Schedule: Always

KEY
1 = Any name you want the server to be (I.E.MyScape).[/glow]
2 = The IP adddress of your COMPUTER; not the Internet.
Then save it. Ok now you can save settings after the rule is saved. Every router is different. Check with the manuals for yours to fully understand how to open the ports. If you cannot find/have a manuel, go to this address:

Port Forwarding

Now your server rule is nice and good. Now we need Java to get your server’s compiler and runserver to work. You can download the newest java at this link:

JDK 6.0

Ok before we can fix the compiler and runeserver, we need to set out variables. Ok go into start menu, then control panel, then system, then advanced, then enviromental variables.

start menu -> control panel -> system -> advanced -> enviromental variables

Ok now find the variable called “path” in the list in that new screen open. Rename it to “PATH” and then for it’s variable value (erase old one):
C:Windows\System32;“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin”

You will also need to set a variables called “classpath”. Make a new variable and give it the name classpath. No add this in for it’s value:
“C:\Program Files\Java\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin”

Ok now go into your server source (if you dont have a rar uncompressor you can download 7zip at this link: 7zip, or you can download rar uncompresser at this link: WinRar. Ok now you can right click the compressed source and click “extract here”),
and now when in your server srouce, right click compile.bat and click “edit”. Then erase everything in it and put this in it’s place:

Code:

@echo off
title Compiler
“%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

Ok now save it and right click runserver.bat and erase all of that and add this:

Code:

@echo off
title Runserver
set java=“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\java.exe”
java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
pause

Ok now we have a working source!

So I can skip the whole step mentioned above?

Read full topic
